skill.name: WordPress Test Analyzer Skill
skill.description: Analyze WordPress theme PHP files to extract testable elements for E2E test generation.
skill.summary: Analyze WordPress theme PHP files to extract testable elements for E2E test generation.
skill.author: CrazySwami

security_audit.summary: The skill performs static analysis on WordPress theme files. It only reads files within the specified theme directory and outputs JSON/markdown reports. No network calls, code execution, or sensitive data access detected.

content.user_title: Analyze WordPress themes for test automation
content.value_statement: WordPress themes contain complex interactions that are hard to test manually. This skill automatically extracts forms, navigation, dynamic content, and JavaScript interactions to generate comprehensive E2E tests.
actual_capabilities: Extract forms with fields, validation, and nonces from PHP files
Identify navigation menus and link structures
Find dynamic content patterns like WP_Query and conditionals
Detect JavaScript interactions and animation functions
Generate JSON or markdown test analysis reports
limitations: Only analyzes PHP and JavaScript files in theme directory
Cannot execute or test actual WordPress functionality
Requires manual interpretation of extracted elements
Limited to static code analysis without runtime behavior

use_cases.title: Automate theme testing workflow
use_cases.description: Extract testable elements from custom themes to create comprehensive Playwright test suites without manual inspection

use_cases.title: Generate E2E test cases
use_cases.description: Quickly identify all forms, navigation, and interactive elements in WordPress sites to build thorough end-to-end tests

use_cases.title: Standardize client site testing
use_cases.description: Create consistent testing documentation for multiple WordPress client projects by analyzing theme structures automatically

prompt_templates.title: Basic theme analysis
prompt_templates.scenario: First time analyzing a WordPress theme
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the WordPress theme at /path/to/theme and extract all testable elements including forms, navigation, and dynamic content

prompt_templates.title: Form-focused testing
prompt_templates.scenario: Testing complex forms in a theme
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all forms from this WordPress theme including their fields, validation rules, nonce fields, and success/error redirects

prompt_templates.title: Interactive elements
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all JavaScript interactions, onclick handlers, class toggles, and animation functions in this WordPress theme

prompt_templates.title: Generate test report
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this WordPress theme and generate a detailed markdown report of all testable elements for the QA team

output_examples.input: Analyze the WordPress theme at /themes/business-theme for testable elements
output: Found 3 forms with 12 total fields including contact form with nonce protection
Identified 5 navigation menus with 28 links across header, footer, and sidebar
Detected 8 dynamic content patterns including WP_Query loops and post meta fields
Found 15 JavaScript interactions including class toggles and animation functions

best_practices: Always specify the full path to your WordPress theme directory
Review extracted forms to ensure nonce fields are properly handled in tests
Use the markdown output format for better human-readable documentation
anti_patterns: Don't use this on production WordPress installations - analyze theme files locally
Avoid testing extracted elements without understanding the underlying WordPress functionality
Don't rely solely on this tool - complement with manual testing of edge cases

faq.question: Which WordPress theme files can this analyze?
faq.answer: The skill analyzes all PHP and JavaScript files within the specified theme directory, including subdirectories.

faq.question: Can it analyze plugin files or WordPress core?
faq.answer: No, the skill is designed specifically for theme analysis. It only processes files within the specified theme directory.

faq.question: Is the analysis safe for production sites?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill only performs read-only static analysis and doesn't modify any files or execute code.

faq.question: How do I use the extracted test elements?
faq.answer: The JSON output provides structured data about forms, links, and interactions that you can use to write Playwright or other E2E tests.

faq.question: What if my theme uses custom PHP functions?
faq.answer: The skill extracts patterns it recognizes. Custom functions may not be detected but standard WordPress patterns will be identified.

faq.question: Can it detect AJAX endpoints or API calls?
faq.answer: The skill looks for WordPress AJAX hooks and patterns in PHP files but cannot detect runtime API calls or dynamic JavaScript requests.
